high_relevance.description: Explains how newcomers learn the values, norms, and behaviors required for organizational membership and role performance
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Directly addresses RQ1 by explaining the socialization process from novice to core developer; informs RQ2 interventions for smoother onboarding
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Could model socialization tactics (collective vs individual, formal vs informal) as stocks/flows affecting knowledge acquisition and identity formation
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Extends CoP by providing specific mechanisms of socialization in distributed, voluntary contexts

high_relevance.description: Motivation theory focusing on three innate psychological needs: autonomy, competence, and relatedness
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Explains motivational drivers for progression (RQ1) and informs motivational interventions (RQ2)
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Could model motivation as stock influenced by autonomy, competence, and relatedness feedback loops
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Provides psychological foundation for understanding why developers progress or stall in OSS careers

high_relevance.description: Implementation science theory explaining how complex interventions become routinely embedded in practice
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Directly addresses RQ2 by providing framework for designing and evaluating interventions
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Could model implementation mechanisms (coherence, cognitive participation, collective action, reflexive monitoring)
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Brings rigorous intervention evaluation framework from healthcare to OSS development

high_relevance.description: Conceptual framework for understanding trade-offs between short-term benefits and long-term quality consequences
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Directly addresses RQ3 by explaining how development practices accumulate vulnerabilities
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Could model technical debt accumulation and interest payment as stocks/flows affecting system quality
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Links career progression patterns to quality outcomes through technical debt mechanisms

adjacent_opportunities.description: Examines how individuals and groups manage interfaces between different organizational domains
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Focuses on interfaces rather than progression within a single community
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: Views core developers as boundary spanners between technical and social domains
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Explains how developers manage multiple community interfaces and knowledge translation

adjacent_opportunities.description: Organization's ability to recognize, assimilate, and apply new external knowledge
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Originally organizational-level, applying to individual developers is creative extension
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: Views developer progression as building individual absorptive capacity for community knowledge
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Links individual learning capacity to community knowledge flows and innovation

adjacent_opportunities.description: Cognition distributed across individuals, artifacts, and environment rather than purely individual
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Shifts focus from individual learning to system-level cognitive processes
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: Views OSS community as distributed cognitive system where knowledge resides in tools, processes, and social structures
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Provides framework for understanding how system architecture affects learning and vulnerability prevention

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: Community development and species replacement over time in ecosystems
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Developer progression as ecological succession; system vulnerabilities as ecosystem fragility
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Provides rich metaphors for community maturation, niche specialization, and system resilience

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: Human and non-human actors in networked arrangements
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Tools, documentation, and infrastructure as active participants in developer progression
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Radically reframes progression as network building rather than individual journey

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: How organizations in hazardous environments maintain safety and prevent failures
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Vulnerability prevention through collective mindfulness and redundancy
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Brings sophisticated failure prevention frameworks from safety-critical domains

phd_strategy.rationale: These three theories directly address the core gaps in each research question while being empirically grounded and modelable in system dynamics. OST provides the socialization mechanisms missing from CoP, SDT explains motivational drivers, and TDT links progression patterns to quality outcomes.
phd_strategy.integration_strategy: Integrate as layered explanations: SDT provides motivational foundation, OST explains socialization processes that operationalize CoP principles, and TDT connects these to system quality outcomes. Model as interconnected feedback loops affecting developer progression and system vulnerability.
phd_strategy.expected_impact: Creates comprehensive theoretical framework explaining how individual motivations and socialization processes interact with community structures to produce both developer progression and system quality outcomes, addressing all three RQs in integrated manner.
